sentence.text: We summarize genetic, clinical and neuropathological findings related to the 27 genes reported in the literature since 1997, associated either with autosomal dominant (AD): LRRK2, SNCA, VPS35, GCH1, ATXN2, DNAJC13, TMEM230, posttranscriptional gene silencing, HTRA2, RIC3, EIF4G1, protein deubiquitination, CHCHD2, and GBA; or autosomal recessive (AR) inheritance: PRKN, PINK1, DJ1, ATP13A2, antibacterial humoral response, FBXO7, DNAJC6, SYNJ1, chemical synaptic transmission, VPS13C, PODXL, and PTRHD1; or an X-linked transmission: RAB39B.
